snippet: Heiner Goebbels’s “I went to the house but did not enter,” at Lincoln Center’s White Light Festival, sets writing by T. S. Eliot, Maurice Blanchot and Samuel Beckett to music in three tableaus.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews German composer and director Heiner Goebbels's musical theater piece I went to the house but did not enter, performed by the Hilliard Ensemble at Jazz at Lincoln Center’s Rose Theater as part of the White Light Festival.
lead_paragraph: Heiner Goebbels’s “I went to the house but did not enter,” at Lincoln Center’s White Light Festival, sets writing by T. S. Eliot, Maurice Blanchot and Samuel Beckett to music in three tableaus.

headline.seo: ‘I Went to the House but Did Not Enter’ by Heiner Goebbels
headline.main: They Grow Old, Waiting for the Sets to Change
headline.print_headline: They Grow Old, Waiting for the Sets to Change
